DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transferase Result Upper Limit of Normal Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values of serum glutamic-oxalacetic transaminase in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Glutamic Oxaloacetic Transferase Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for serum glutamic-oxalacetic transaminase, pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Activity measured as a test of liver function, 46/47-kDa homodimeric human Aspartate Aminotransferases (Class-I Pyridoxal-Phosphate-Dependent Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. (NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. Aspartate aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-aspartate to alpha-ketoglutarate forming oxaloacetate and L-glutamate.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
